parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It focuses on an educational event organized by "Romania Eficienta" with the support of the Ministry of Energy.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content describes an event aimed at primary school students, but the advertisement itself targets a broader demographic, as evidenced by the reach estimate of ">1M".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an educational event focused on energy efficiency, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content is related to environmental awareness and education, not electoral campaigning.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of citizen journalism, reporting on a public event with educational value. It provides information about the event, its participants, and its purpose, without advocating for any particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it reports factual information about a public event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1295517918131552</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an educational event on energy efficiency, organized by "Romania Eficienta" with support from the Ministry of Energy.  The content is factual, reporting on a public event and its educational impact. There is no mention of any parliamentary candidate or party, nor any attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections. The post's objective is purely informational and educational, not electoral. While the post is a paid advertisement, its content and purpose do not align with the definition of electoral propaganda as outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post does not meet the criteria of "direct reference to a candidate or political party," "electoral objective," or exceeding the limits of journalistic information.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Romania Eficienta</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
